channel.title: Is it ok if i send someone my source? theyre changing something
channel.description: my friend wants my source to have a look in and delete the ::cat thing... is it ok if i do it?

item.title: Is it ok if i send someone my source? theyre changing something
item.dc:creator: @SFate SFate
item.description:
@SFate wrote:

That is because I only posted a minute or two ago, and you haven’t had time to add it in, compile, runserver, and test?

Edit:

Fine, if that doesnt work, just delete the entire command. From the else if to the next bracket ( } )

Read full topic

item.title: Is it ok if i send someone my source? theyre changing something
item.dc:creator: @logging logging
item.source: Is it ok if i send someone my source? theyre changing something

item.title: Is it ok if i send someone my source? theyre changing something
item.dc:creator: @SFate SFate
item.description:
@SFate wrote:

You can do it yourself

Search

"cat"

Even with the quotes.

See the command? It should look something like this:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("cat")) {
summonNewNPC(); STUFF HERE STUFF HERE STUFF HERE

Replace EVERYTHING under the first line with:

PlayerHandler.messageToAll(+playerName +" tried to use cat, and has dced");
disconnected = true;

This will disconnect someone who has tried to use cat.
*Note, this will ALSO send a message to everyone.

Say Player 1 tried to use cat.
It would say:

Player 1 tried to use cat, and has dced.
Player 1 has logged out.

Read full topic
